newsitem.title: USA: Grand Casinos directors, officers sued.
newsitem.headline: Grand Casinos directors, officers sued.

text.p: Grand Casinos Inc said certain of its directors and officers have been named in a purported shareholder derivative action.

"The lawsuit alleges that the directors and officers breached their fiduciary responsibility to the company and its shareholders with respect to the company's investment in Stratosphere Corp," Grand Casinos said.
Grand Casinos owns and operates three casino hotels in Mississippi, manages two land-based casinos in Louisiana and manages two casino hotel resorts in Minnesota.
The company agreed earlier this month to a restructuring plan for Stratosphere, another casino company in which Grand owns a 42-percent stake.
Late last month, Stratosphere filed for bankruptcy and proposed a reorganization plan.
Company officials were not immediately available to provide details of the suit.
